conclusion: The coach bus is traveling at a constant speed of 20 m/s and spots a puppy at a distance of 45 m.
The time interval between the driver seeing the puppy and the bus starting to decelerate is 0.5s.
The velocity-time graph shows the bus traveling at 20 m/s until 0.5s, then decelerating uniformly to 0 m/s at 5.0s.
During the 0.50 s reaction time, the bus travels 10 m.
The magnitude of the constant deceleration is -4.4 m/s².
The distance covered while braking is 45 m.
Total distance travelled before coming to rest is 55 m.
Since 55 m > 45 m, the bus reaches the puppy’s position before stopping.
Final answer: No—the puppy is not safe; the bus would still be moving when it reaches the 45 m mark.
